page.title: 03Faxton Grange Farm,Old
page.content:
The farm is about 340 acres.The weather this year has affected the crops badly.The very wet and cold spring has delayed harvesting by about 3 weeks and produced more mildew on the corn than normal.
The soil is heavy clay but reasonably fertile.Nitrogen fertilisers are used in the Spring and Phosphates and Potash in the Winter.This is very expensive.
The burning of straw is a problem as the fields are small and setting hedges on fire is a hazard.They have tried compressing the straw into small brick sized pieces {(brickets)}to burn in a wood burning stove,but this was not very successful,as they did not burn well enough.
